item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Hi Rasmus,</p><p>It sounds like you have a more serious issue than just sessionScope variables.</p><p>Questions I'd ask are:</p><p>1) What hardware are you running on? Specifically how much memory does the server have?</p><p>2) Have you changed any of the Notes.ini memory settings for XPages, have a look at this page for more details: http://www.stevecastledine.com/sc.nsf/dx/xpages-memory-usage-and-performance-tips-8.5?opendocument</p><p>3) What are you storing in the sessionScope? Are you reading in very large objects?</p><p>Hope this helps.</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Rasmus,

It sounds like you have a more serious issue than just sessionScope variables.

Questions I’d ask are:

1) What hardware are you running on? Specifically how much memory does the server have?

2) Have you changed any of the Notes.ini memory settings for XPages, have a look at this page for more details: http://www.stevecastledine.com/sc.nsf/dx/xpages-memory-usage-and-performance-tips-8.5?opendocument

3) What are you storing in the sessionScope? Are you reading in very large objects?

Hope this helps.

Matt

item.title: By: Rasmus Bauck
item.dc:creator: Rasmus Bauck
item.description: <p>We are rewriting a Notes intranet application to use XPages and everything is working fine (although a bit slow) in the development environment. Once we try to go live, the server crashes within a minute and the log is flooded with this message:</p><p>01.12.2009 15:07:07 HTTP JVM: SEVERE: CLFAD####E: Exception processing XPage request</p><p>For the server console: "Out of Backend Memory"</p><p>Any thoughts on whether this might be related to the SessionScope trouble described in this blog post?<br/>The company has several thousands of employees, and the front page is accessed frequently by many of them.</p>
item.content:encoded:
We are rewriting a Notes intranet application to use XPages and everything is working fine (although a bit slow) in the development environment. Once we try to go live, the server crashes within a minute and the log is flooded with this message:

01.12.2009 15:07:07 HTTP JVM: SEVERE: CLFAD####E: Exception processing XPage request

For the server console: "Out of Backend Memory"

Any thoughts on whether this might be related to the SessionScope trouble described in this blog post?
The company has several thousands of employees, and the front page is accessed frequently by many of them.
